article: Tong Shiqiang rushed into a kindergarten behind his primary school several times, carrying a  _  of kids each time he rushed out of their classroom on that fateful day. Only 14 years old and 1.5m tall, Tong can now  _  a national bravery award for saving seven children. The grade-6 student was  _  a Chinese language class in Zhongwang Primary School in Qishan village of Longnan city, one of the worst-hit areas in Gansu province,  _  the deadly quake struck on May 12,2008. There were  other  students in his class at the time. "Windows began rattling and it  _  as if lots of bees were singing underground,"  _  Tong Shuangxi, Tong Shiqiang's teacher and uncle. "The sound grew  louder  ... and then I  _  it was an earthquake." The teacher cried: "  _  out!" All the students ran out of the room immediately.  _  outside, Tong Shuangxi rushed toward the kindergarten where the children  were having  a nap . Tong Shiqiang ran with him. Only three of the kids had  _  to run out of their room when they  _  the building. The rest were crying, too  _  to move. It  _  less than three minutes for them to carry out all the five- and six-year-olds to  _  .  Not sure  whether all the kids had been saved, Tong and his nephew had  _  begun checking the name list when the classroom's walls fell down. "That's the only time I was scared," said Tong Shiqiang. The 14-year-old is  _  to be nominated for the child hero award, to be given by the Ministry of Education and the Central Committee of the Chinese Communist Youth League.
